posts.post_content:

Posted By: Hellcarver (4/28/2010 7:07:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like this card.. I actually find lightmine field to not be the most amazing combination, since it would take a lot of creatures in play to even kill off something like a malakir bloodwitch, but it has such interesting combinations it makes a great combo piece.
  
   
Mostly red cards are great with this, such as kazuul tyrant of the cliffs, and fumiko. Lust for war is a nifty enchantment that works well in this regard as well.
  
   
I think people might over hype gideon for a while too, since he doesn't fit in every deck, and his ultimate is pretty awesome, but isn't that far removed from indestructibility which isn't really a big threat right now with consuming vapors, cruel edict, path to exile, iona's judgement, and many others. Also note it says damage only, not if it gets terminated or etc.
  
   
Having said all that, love the abilities, killing a tapped creature is a really nice effect on a planeswalker, the first ability is fantastic for walls, and the ultimate never hurts sinc... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I really like this card.. I actually find lightmine field to not be the most amazing combination, since it would take a lot of creatures in play to even kill off something like a malakir bloodwitch, but it has such interesting combinations it makes a great combo piece.

Mostly red cards are great with this, such as kazuul tyrant of the cliffs, and fumiko. Lust for war is a nifty enchantment that works well in this regard as well.

I think people might over hype gideon for a while too, since he doesn't fit in every deck, and his ultimate is pretty awesome, but isn't that far removed from indestructibility which isn't really a big threat right now with consuming vapors, cruel edict, path to exile, iona's judgement, and many others. Also note it says damage only, not if it gets terminated or etc.

Having said all that, love the abilities, killing a tapped creature is a really nice effect on a planeswalker, the first ability is fantastic for walls, and the ultimate never hurts sinc... (see all)

Posted By: DooDooBrown (7/28/2010 11:54:24 AM)

posts.post_content:
The +2 is incredible, in my opinion. Many times, I've been in a situation where I wish the opponent would attack, so battle would be on my terms, not theirs. If you have things like indestructible Palace Guards, you have no worries. The -2 is obviously a response to the +2.  
  
But the 0 is where he shines. In a set where Eldrazi loom overhead, people forget about the Soldier decks from M10. If you stick him in there, he's pumped, has Vigilance, First Strike, and whatever other tricks you may have for soldiers (there are . . . a few).  
  
@pixieCrack  
  
Why can afford him, you ask? I can. He's about 4$ when he comes in a booster. That's how I got Kalitas, Lorthos, Lotus Cobra, Sorin Markov, Elvish Pipers, Darksteel Colossus, Liliana Vess, Garruk, Jace, Admonition Angel, Xathrid Demon, and most of my other stuff. Fat-packs are also pretty nice investments for 35$ a piece.
posts.html:

But the 0 is where he shines. In a set where Eldrazi loom overhead, people forget about the Soldier decks from M10. If you stick him in there, he's pumped, has Vigilance, First Strike, and whatever other tricks you may have for soldiers (there are . . . a few).

posts.post_content:
He gets five for flavor.
  
   
Have a few things to add:
  
   
"Blowing up tapped creatures is mainly a black ability." Actually not, blowing up creatures period is black. Tapped destruction is a white thing, it always has been sort of "punishment for attacking" flavor wise.
  
   
"still waiting for yawgmoth planeswalker, pls just implode all these stupid planes and go back to dominaria"
  
   
While Yawgmoth did use technology to traverse the planes, he is not a planeswalker. He never was.
posts.html:
